Riqui Puig: ''If I do not have any minutes with the first team, I will have to make a decision."

Riqui Puig: "The third division (Segunda B) is a category that is passing through, not all the youth players want to be here for many years because we aspire to play in higher categories. In theory I will not ;eave in January, but we will see." #fcblive

"I do not close the door, but it is true that I would like to have more minutes on the first team. There are enough people and it costs a lot to have minutes on the first team. If I do not have any minutes with the first team, I will have to make a decision."

"I'm not training so much with the first team this season, last year I was practically in dynamics of the first team. I trained with them and I went down to play with B team. But they are football things and you have to play with your feet on the ground."

replies.msg:
I can't take this anymore. I don't think any Barcelona can.

It's like Valverde looked at his notebook of how to make everything even worse and decided to deploy an aberration of a tactical formation. Messi lost as #9, Vidal as forward, Frenkie lost, while the opposition pressed and build from the back like they are a Guardiola team.

Griezmann is nothing more than a €120m left back that doesn’t attack for most of the match! If the Frenchman ends up a disaster of a signing, it'll be because of Valverde, the destroyer of dreams. Dembélé was isolated and marked, losing balls all by himself and there's no plan by Valverde, can't keep blaming the kid.

Lately Frenkie De Jong has been reduced to a simple ball carrier into the final third, it's a nonsensical waste of his talents. No wonder the player liked a #ValverdeOut Instagram post a few weeks ago.

This Champions League season Ter Stegen is the only thing standing between Valverde and the sack. Barcelona could have legitimately be at the bottom of the group if not for him and lucky breaks. SLAVIA PRAHA outplayed one of the most expensive squads of all time with the greatest footballer of all time for one hundred and eighty matches, two entire matches. This is not Roma or Anfield, but it’s a fucking humiliation.

Jordi Alba injured again and the €30m left back signed this summer is in the fucking stands, dropped and ignored by the same coach that asked for his signing. Arthur is also being sent to the stands without any explanation, sometimes I fear Rakitic will crawl back into the starting eleven.

I don't say it lightly when I claim that I never thought a coach could do so much harm to Barcelona as long as Messi was there.

No ideas, no playing style, no tactics, no balls and no coach. #ValverdeOut
